description: Niki Wyatt, 30, and Samantha Lochrie, 23, from North Yorkshire, met at a youth club for people with disabilities. They set up their own social club after they were told off for kissing.
title: Down's Syndrome couple get engaged on This Morning
title_page: Down's Syndrome couple get engaged on This Morning | Daily Mail Online
text:
A man with Down's syndrome got down on one knee to ask his girlfriend to marry him live on This Morning.
Viewers were brought to tears when Niki Wyatt, 30, took the studio by surprise as he popped the question to Samantha Lochrie, 23, who also has Down's syndrome.
The audience at home took to Twitter to express their delight for the North Yorkshire couple, who were on the show discussing how staff at a youth club told them their kissing was 'inappropriate'.
Discussion turned to much more pleasant matters when Niki presented Samantha with a ring, in a moment one viewer described as 'one of the most beautiful things I've seen on TV'.
Niki decided to propose to his girlfriend Samantha again but this time live on This Morning for millions of viewers to witness - and they shared a lovely kiss as their mothers looked on
Niki got down on one knee in front of presenters Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes who clapped and cheered when Samantha said 'yes'
The couple appeared on the show to discuss the reaction of staff at a youth club to their kissing
The couple, who were watched by their mothers and full-time carers, Jackie Wyatt and Kim Lochrie, were already engaged, but Niki wanted his chance to ask Samantha to spend her life with him as the world was watching.
And viewers labelled it the 'cutest thing ever' as Samantha answered with 'yes, I love you.'
'That proposal was the cutest thing I have ever witnessed!! In absolute tears! How utterly heartwarming! Good luck to Sam & Nicky!' gushed one viewer.
Viewers watching the heartwarming moment at home couldn't control their emotions as they gushed about how adorable the proposal was
'That proposal was the cutest thing I have ever witnessed!!' another said on Twitter.
One emotional viewer tweeted: 'Oh, that marriage proposal is one of the most beautiful things I've seen on TV! They've actually brought me to tears!'
Niki and Samantha met at a youth club for people with disabilities.
However, when they shared a kiss at a youth club they were told to stop by staff who deemed their behaviour 'inappropriate' despite them both being over 18.
Niki and Sam first met at a social club for people with disabilities but when they were admonished for kissing they decided to start their own group
Niki presented his new fiance a ring and their mothers - and viewers at home - were all brough to tears
The surprise on-air proposal left viewers watching at home overcome with emotion
Many viewers were delighted to see the young couple get their happy ending on the show
The incident left the couple and their mothers determined to provide their children with a social club that catered for the needs of disabled young adults.
The JK Club, an inclusive Friday night social event for adults with disabilities, has now celebrated its first anniversary.
This Morning airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
